items.preText: 10.45pm We're all set. Let's hope the weather stays clear. Mashrafe Mortaza gives his team a pep talk before the huddle disperses. Sunil Ambris and Shai Hope will open West Indies' batting. Mashrafe has the new ball, as always. Worried glances from the umpires, looking up at the clouds. One wide slip in place. Vinod Rajpal: "Was awaiting for Shakib's 250th ODI wicket from last 2 ODIs....now have to wait till 2nd of June !!" Khademul Haque: "Can BD break the final jinx? They should, even without Shakib. Even though I would prefer Naeem instead of Mosaddek for the final (because I believe against Windies Shakib's bowling would be missed rather than his batting and Mosaddek is nowhere near him as a bowler) but keeping the World Cup in mind, it is a good decision to play him. That means the management is more concerned with the ultimate tournament and not taking the pressure. It is a good sign, jinx remains jinx when you think of that!" Vanja Patrakar: "Looks like Bangladesh testing their bench. Liton Das and Abu Jayed, their best batsman and their best bowler from last match not in playing XI with their star man Shakib rested. Testing is great but winning at this stage is more important." 10.40am Thanks, Sreshth, and hello, everyone else. The skies look quite gloomy as the teams stand for the anthems. 10.38am As the national anthems get underway, it's time to welcome Karthik Krishnaswamy to commentary. khaled: "i think Bangladesh's main opponent is "the law of average"" Jason Holder: "Very crucial game, got some youngsters who aren't going to the World Cup but nonetheless will be aiming to do well. Cottrell isn't available, so Shannon Gabriel is back." < Meanwhile, Arantxa Sanchez Vicario is in Bengaluru in connection with a 10k run this Sunday. Not too many surprises in whom the former world no.1 picks as her favourites for the French Open 10.34pm Will the no-Shakib curse haunt Bangladesh in another tournament final? Not only has he now missed three straight ODI finals for Bangladesh, but the Tigers are yet to win an ODI final in four previous attempts. Can they break that run today? Have your say while checking out their other final losses. M Venkat Raghav: "So Bangladesh remove their best batsman and best bowler from their previous game" Nitish: "This is a very important game for Darren Bravo the Windies team as a whole. He hasnt done much to justify his spot in the WC so far..just one 50+ score in 11 innings since his return in Dec 2018. He may not have a place in the playing 11 when the likes of Pooran and Russell get back into the team but his performance in this series so far hasnt done the team any favours." 10.17am Toss - Bangladesh opt to field, says Mashrafe Mortaza. But no Shakib, still recovering from a back spasm. Rubel, Jayed and Liton not playing as well. Bangladesh XI: 1 Tamim Iqbal, 2 Soumya Sarkar, 3 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 4 Mohammad Mithun, 5 Mahmudullah, 6, Mossaddek Hussain, 7 Sabbir Rahman, 8 Mohammed Saifuddin, 9 Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 10 Mashrafe Mortaza (capt), 11 Mustafizur Rahman West Indies XI: 1 Sunil Ambris, 2 Shai Hope (wk), 3 Darren Bravo, 4 Roston Chase, 5 Jonathan Carter, 6 Jason Holder (capt), 7 Fabian Allen, 8 Ashley Nurse, 9 Kemar Roach, 10 Ramon Reiffer, 11 Shannon Gabriel Nitol: "That makes it three consecutive ODI final for Bangladesh without Shakib due to injury" Sherwin graham: "Goodmornng, I think windies should try something different, take Bangladesh out of their comfort zone, the tigers have beaten windies twice batting second. This is a finals, if windies win toss insert the tigers. Bangladesh have not had any pressure, they was bossing around windies in those two games. " A. Sensarma: "This is a very paradoxical dilemma, and it will help both teams going forward because similar weather will be seen in England at this World Cup, in similar high-pressure circumstances: do you put runs on the board first to avoid scoreboard pressure (and afflict it on the opposition in the big games), or do you go for stability chasing in the face of interruptive weather instead? Considering this is a trial-and-error tournament, irrespective of the result both teams will learn lessons today!" Rajiv Jaiswal: "Sakib likely not to play today... Looks like Bangladesh have reserved him for world cup... Strategically correct... Chances of rain will certainly reduce the total numbers of play today" 10am Just fifteen minutes to go for the toss, but there's a bit of weather around in Malahide today. Cloudy skies, temperatures of 11 degrees, with a fairly high chance of rain in about an hour. Win toss, bat second then? Mahmudul Haque: "I think toss will tell both teams fortune." Gazi gazi : "Dear cricinfo could you please publish my comment please!!! Is mahanadulla and shakib injury serious and any updates in em?" -- Hey, we understand that a call on Shakib will be taken today morning. Mahmudullah should be fine to play SAHIL KANWAR: "A match between Bangladesh and West Indies in Ireland.Wondering how the crowd would be .I guess it would be filled with cricket lovers like me. :)" 9.55am We're in Malahide for the final of the Tri-nation series hosted by Ireland. Today we have West Indies meeting Bangladesh for their final official ODI before the World Cup, but thoughts of that tournament need to wait. Both teams have an opportunity to win a trophy today, and it's the perfect way to simulate big-match moments that teams may face during a World Cup knockout game. So expect a high-octane contest. West Indies are looking to avoid a third-straight loss at the hands of Bangladesh in the tournament, while the Tigers may be without Shakib Al Hasan today. Team news and match preview right here for you to dig in. My name is Sreshth Shah, and together with Karthik Krishnaswamy, we welcome you to ESPNcricinfo's coverage of this game.
items.text: stays back to a fullish one angling into off stump, brings his bat down hurriedly to defend. Did it keep a touch low too?
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: a little fuller, similar line, clipped to mid-on
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: lovely full length, not up there for the drive but getting the batsman coming half forward, angling in towards off stump. Defended off the inside half of the bat towards midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: fullish again, on that off-stump line, clipped to midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: drifts a little straighter, onto middle and leg, clipped to the right of midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, 1 run

items.text: back of a length, angling into off stump, gets behind it to work it to the right of midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, 1 run

items.preText:
Saifuddin.

Seth: ""Mashrafe has the new ball, as always." I wouldn't say as always. :) Just last game he didn't come on until the 29th over!! Although that was an anomaly."
items.text: length ball, fifth-stump line, a bit of gentle outswing. Left alone
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, no run

items.preText: Third man and fine leg back, one wide slip. Same field as Mashrafe, pretty much.
items.text: shortish, a bit of width, Ambris cuts hard but straight to backward point
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, no run

items.text: fuller now, angling into off stump and swinging away late. Presses hesitantly forward and pokes at it in defence, and the ball swerves past his outside edge
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, no run

items.text: length ball close to off stump, blocked into the covers
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, no run

items.text: shortish in the corridor, lets it come on and guides it down to third man
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, 1 run

items.text: back of a length on middle stump, looks to pick up a single to the right of midwicket but the fielder closes down the ball quickly
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, no run

items.text: length ball angling in towards off stump, defended to short extra-cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.text: a bit fuller, on middle stump, uses his wrists to turn it to midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.text: there's the first boundary. After hugging that off-stump line so tightly, Mashrafe sends down a wide half-volley, and Ambris drives with high left elbow, into the gap between short extra-cover and mid-off
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, FOUR runs

items.text: length ball on off stump, clipped watchfully to midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run

items.text: full outside off, and Ambris looks for another big cover drive. The line's closer to off stump this time, and he ends up hitting too early, with the bottom hand creeping in, and he loses his shape and drags it through square leg instead
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, 3 runs

items.text: back of a length on off stump, blocked to midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.preText:
A little bit of nibble off the pitch, and the ball isn't quite coming on as well as the batsmen would like, just yet.

Tasmeem: "This is the final testing phase, so it was the perfect chance to experiment at a dead rubber. Don't think he would do the same at any crunch match. Also looks like there will be no place for Liton in the playing XI at the World Cup as well."
items.text: shortish, not too much width, chopped to backward point
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, no run

items.text: fullish outswinger, fourth-stump line, gets on the front foot to block it back to the bowler
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, no run

items.text: back of a length close to off stump, gets back and across and defends towards the non-striker
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, no run

items.text: stays back to a length ball on off stump, defends with soft hands into the on side
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, no run

items.text: back of a length, not too far outside off. Stays leg-side of the ball this time and runs it down to third man
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Ambris, 1 run

items.text: back of a length on off stump, clipped to midwicket off the back foot
items.postText: Chris Lawrence: "At who's expense would Chris 'Universe Boss' Gayle and Andre 'The Giant' Russell play at the CWC19?" -- Hope and Carter, from this XI? And I'm also guessing Hetmyer comes in for Chase.
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, no run

items.text: back of a length close to off stump, gets on top of the bounce and chops it down to backward point
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Ambris, no run
